Prove that\[R(4,k) \gg \frac{k^3}{(\log k)^{O(1)}}.\]



Spencer \cite{Sp77} proved\[R(4,k) \gg (k\log k)^{5/2}.\]Ajtai, Koml\'{o}s, and Szemer\'{e}di \cite{AKS80} proved\[R(4,k) \ll \frac{k^3}{(\log k)^2}.\]This is true, and was proved by Mattheus and Verstraete \cite{MaVe23}, who showed that\[R(4,k) \gg \frac{k^3}{(\log k)^4}.\]This problem is #5 in Ramsey Theory in the graphs problem collection.

See also [986] for the general case.




References


[AKS80] Ajtai, Mikl\'{o}s and Koml\'{o}s, J\'{a}nos and Szemer\'{e}di, Endre, A note on Ramsey numbers. J. Combin. Theory Ser. A (1980), 354-360.

[MaVe23] Mattheus, S. and Verstraete, J., The asymptotics of $r(4,t)$. arXiv:2306.04007 (2023).

[Sp77] Spencer, J., Asymptotic lower bounds for Ramsey functions. Discrete Math. (1977), 69-76.
